content.description: This very steep, proud, and beautiful line is the distinct center crack up the main face of the motherly love boulder. As of fall 2020 unclimbed.Crux moves are right off the deck and involve some very powerful movement off of a right hand gaston and tiny, high left hand crimp. Gain the main crack and work pumpy, less than secure movement to increasingly better holds. top out as for Motherly Love.The opening moves are probably in the ~v7 range.Climb the thing then name it/rate it.

climbs.name: Motherly Love
climbs.fa: First ascent after the LB Fire, Phillip Heinstein, TR with topout

content.description: Get ready to Grovel. Off width start that blends into the face, before optionally topping out.Start as low as you are willing to in the steep, and harder than it looks, off width on the left side of the face. Work through difficulty to gain the no hands rest just below the giant block, then using the pumpy jugs and face holds work up and eventually to the right of the anchors before topping out.R rating if done without the rope - though the climbing is ~20 feet long, the top of the route is about 35 feet over a nasty landing.Â If bouldered, would be a serious undertaking, and one with very high consequences.

Start as for motherly love, but go straight up through the seemingly detached block. Block actually feels super solid. Difficulty eases once you get to the face.We avoided this line for a good while, unsure of the block. Ferris ran into us playing on the line one day, and after watching us work "Motherly Love" promptly committed to the direct line and flashed it. Phillip quickly repeated the line, opting to top out.Some gritty rock on the top half, will clean up with time.
content.location: Left, direct line up through the chunky block, hence "impending disaster"

content.description: Steep boulder with a few TR lines. Incredible rock and awesome, humbling, offwidth style climbing.
